summary: This is an email from August 2, 2019, summarizing key meetings and contacts made by the prosecution team in the Jeffrey Epstein case over the preceding week. It details meetings with Epstein's defense attorneys, attorneys for a former personal assistant, and multiple victims, outlining discussions about potential cooperation and new allegations of sexual assault and rape.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central defendant in the case. The document discusses meetings with his attorneys about a potential resolution or cooperation, and details new allegations of sexual assault and rape from multiple victims.

persons.name: Ms. [Victim 1]
persons.context: A victim who was sexually assaulted by Epstein in Florida, New Mexico, and the Virgin Islands around 2004 when she was 16-17. She lived and traveled with him, and reported being raped on multiple occasions.

persons.name: Ms. [Victim 2]
persons.context: A New York victim introduced to Epstein around 2004 when she was 16. She was sexually abused during 'massage' sessions at his Manhattan residence, with the abuse escalating to rape.

persons.name: Ms. [Victim 3]
persons.context: One of two victims represented by California attorneys. She was recruited to perform 'massages' for Epstein in New York around 2004, during which she was sexually assaulted and paid.

persons.name: Ms. [Victim 4]
persons.context: One of two victims represented by California attorneys. She was recruited to perform 'massages' for Epstein in New York around 2004, during which she was sexually assaulted and paid.

persons.name: [Epstein's Personal Assistant]
persons.context: One of Epstein's personal assistants during the period of the charged conduct. Her attorneys described her relationship with Epstein as sexually abusive and provided a proffer about her role in scheduling massages.

connections.description: Epstein sexually assaulted and raped Ms. [Victim 1] in multiple locations when she was 16-17. She lived and traveled with him.
Epstein sexually abused and ultimately raped Ms. [Victim 2] during paid 'massage' sessions at his Manhattan residence, knowing she was 16.
The assistant was employed by Epstein. Her attorneys described the relationship as sexually abusive, and she was involved in scheduling massages for him.
Ms. [Victim 1] reported that her travel to Epstein's properties was scheduled by one of Epstein's assistants in New York, believed to be this individual.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein's Defense Attorneys
events.description: The prosecution team met with Epstein's attorneys. They discussed, in general terms, the possibility of a resolution or Epstein's cooperation, but no specific proposal was made.

events.title: Meeting with Assistant's Counsel
events.description: The team met with counsel for one of Epstein's former personal assistants. The attorneys provided an initial proffer describing a sexually abusive relationship with Epstein and her role in scheduling massages.

events.title: Interview with Victim 1
events.description: The team met with Ms. [Victim 1], who detailed being sexually assaulted and raped by Epstein in multiple locations (FL, NM, USVI) when she was 16-17. She lived and traveled with him.

events.title: Interview with Victim 2
events.description: The team met with Ms. [Victim 2], a New York victim. She described being sexually abused during paid massages at Epstein's Manhattan residence starting at age 16, with the abuse escalating to rape.

events.title: Contact with California Attorneys
events.description: The team spoke by phone with attorneys in California representing two additional victims (Ms. [Victim 3] and Ms. [Victim 4]) who were assaulted by Epstein in New York around 2004.

events.title: Scheduled Follow-up with Assistant's Counsel
events.description: The team planned to talk again with counsel for the former personal assistant to further explore potential cooperation.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team initiated discussions about a potential resolution or cooperation, but provided no specific proposal.
A former personal assistant of Epstein was described by her attorneys as having a sexually abusive relationship with him and being involved in scheduling massages.
A new victim (Ms. [Victim 1]) came forward alleging Epstein raped her on multiple occasions in Florida, New Mexico, and the Virgin Islands when she was 16-17, and she lived/traveled with him.
Partially nude photographs of this victim, taken when she was approximately 17, were identified among materials seized from Epstein's New York residence.
The prosecution was in contact with attorneys for two additional victims in California, expanding the scope of the investigation.
